block.p: Melissa Suzanne Pace, who is in public relations, and Chad Stevens Cascadden, a professional football player, were married on Friday evening at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Joseph Schlafer performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Cascadden, 25, is the director of public relations for Only Hearts, a lingerie and women's sportswear company in New York. She graduated from Hofstra University. She is the daughter of Donna N. Pace of Montville, N.J., and the late Dr. Richard K. Pace. Her mother is a case manager and nurse at the Garden State Hospice in Cranford, N.J. The bride's father was a family practice physician with offices in Little Falls, N.J., and Boca Raton, Fla.

Melissa Suzanne Pace, who is in public relations, and Chad Stevens Cascadden, a professional football player, were married on Friday evening at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Joseph Schlafer performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Cascadden, 25, is the director of public relations for Only Hearts, a lingerie and women's sportswear company in New York. She graduated from Hofstra University. She is the daughter of Donna N. Pace of Montville, N.J., and the late Dr. Richard K. Pace. Her mother is a case manager and nurse at the Garden State Hospice in Cranford, N.J. The bride's father was a family practice physician with offices in Little Falls, N.J., and Boca Raton, Fla.

Mr. Cascadden, 28, was a linebacker for the New York Jets from 1995 until the end of last season, following a knee injury. He graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison, where he was an academic all-Big Ten. He is the son of Mary E. Cascadden and Frederick S. Cascadden, both of Eau Claire, Wis., and the stepson of Tess Cascadden. His father is a regional sales director for the American Greetings Corporation, a card company.
